excerpt: Landmark octagonal domed church known for its elaborate, richly colored Byzantine mosaics.
detail_description: The Basilica of San Vitale is a renowned octagonal domed church famous for its intricate and vibrant Byzantine mosaics. The mosaics feature tesserae cut in regular and irregular sizes, creating a stunning visual effect. The transition from naturalistic representations to mosaics with golden backgrounds reflects the ideological and stylistic changes of the time.
name: Basilica of San Vitale
address: Via San Vitale, 17, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Church built by Theodoric the Great as his palace-chapel, listed by UNESCO for its religious art.
detail_description: Basilica di Sant'Apollinare Nuovo, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is a church with a rich history and stunning religious art. Originally built as the palace-chapel of Theodoric the Great, it features intricate mosaics that depict Processions of Martyrs and Virgins on the walls of its central nave. The mosaics showcase a transition from naturalistic representations to those with golden backgrounds, symbolizing transcendence and the glory of Christ.
name: Basilica di Sant'Apollinare Nuovo
address: Via di Roma, 53, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: 5th century chapel built in the shape of a Latin cross, embellished with colorful Roman mosaics.
detail_description: Mausoleo di Galla Placidia is a 5th-century chapel in the shape of a Latin cross, adorned with vibrant Roman mosaics. It is located in the churchyard alongside Basilica di San Vitale and holds three sarcophagi believed to contain the remains of Aelia Galla Placidia, Emperor Constantius III, Emperor Valentinian III or Emperor Onorio.
name: Mausoleo di Galla Placidia
address: Via San Vitale, 17, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: The tomb of the poet Dante, in a small neoclassical temple near the site of his funeral in 1321.
detail_description: Dante's Tomb is a small neoclassical temple located near the site of the poet Dante's funeral in 1321. It has become a national monument and is situated in the Basilica of San Francesco, where an area of silence called the 'Dante area' has been established around it.
name: Dante's Tomb
address: Via Dante Alighieri, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Octagonal baptistery largely dating to the 5th century, renowned for its Byzantine mosaics.
detail_description: The Battistero Neoniano, also known as the Orthodox Baptistery, is a remarkable octagonal baptistery that dates back to the 5th century and is celebrated for its Byzantine mosaics. The mosaics are crafted with tesserae of irregular yet consistent sizes, creating a stunning visual effect. This ancient monument showcases a significant shift in artistic representation from naturalistic motifs to mosaics with golden backgrounds, symbolizing transcendence and the glory of Christ.
name: Battistero Neoniano (o degli Ortodossi)
address: P.za Arcivescovado, 1, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Ravenna is a city in Emilia-Romagna, Italy. It's known for the colorful mosaics adorning many of its central buildings, like the octagonal Basilica di San Vitale, the 6th-century Basilica di Sant'Apollinare Nuovo and the cross-shaped Mausoleo di Galla Placidia. North of the center, the Mausoleo di Teodorico built in the 6th century for King Theodoric the Great, is a Gothic, circular stone tomb with a monolithic dome.
detail_description: Ravenna, located in Emilia-Romagna, Italy, is renowned for its vibrant mosaics that adorn many of its central buildings. The city boasts architectural marvels such as the Basilica di San Vitale, Basilica di Sant'Apollinare Nuovo, and Mausoleo di Galla Placidia. Additionally, visitors can explore the Gothic Mausoleo di Teodorico built for King Theodoric the Great in the 6th century.
name: Ravenna
address: Province of Ravenna, Italy

excerpt: Archaeological site with Byzantine-era pastoral mosaics etched in flooring beneath a 1747 church.
detail_description: Chiesa di Sant'Eufemia-Domus dei Tappeti di Pietra is an archaeological site in Ravenna, Italy, known for its stunning mosaic floors. Discovered in 1993, it showcases remains of a Byzantine palace from the 5th and 6th centuries. The intricate mosaics depict geometric patterns, mythological scenes, and daily life, reflecting the exceptional artistry of that era.
name: Chiesa di Sant'Eufemia-Domus dei Tappeti di Pietra
address: Via Gian Battista Barbiani, 16, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Gothic, stone-built circular mausoleum with monolithic dome erected in 520 for Theodoric the Great.
detail_description: The Mausoleum of Theodoric is a significant historical site in Ravenna, Italy. Built in 520 for the Great Theodoric, it is a circular gothic structure with a monolithic dome. Legend has it that the red porphyry tub on the top floor is where the emperor took his last breath before being struck by lightning and thrown into Mount Etna by a black horse.
name: Mausoleo di Teodorico
address: Via delle Industrie, 14, 48122 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: The National Museum of Ravenna, located in the grand complex of Basilica San Vitale, houses a diverse collection including funeral steles, epigraphs, textiles, ivory pieces, icons, coins, medals and ancient weapons. The museum offers an intriguing glimpse into the history of Ravenna. One of its notable attractions is the Mausoleum of Theodoric with its impressive decagonal plan and massive stone blocks.
name: National Museum of Ravenna
address: Via San Vitale, 17, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Lively plaza with cafes & 15th-century stone columns, surrounded by historic architecture.
detail_description: Fontanella Piazza del Popolo is a vibrant and lively plaza adorned with 15th-century stone columns, surrounded by historic architecture. It boasts numerous cafes and restaurants that offer outdoor terraces to savor the view of the beautiful buildings while enjoying delicious food. The square is long and thin, featuring stunning architecture that adds to its charm. Though it may not be the most impressive square one has seen, it's still worth visiting without spending too much time here.
name: Piazza del Popolo
address: P.za del Popolo, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: The Archbishop's Chapel of St. Andrew, also known as St. Andrew Chapel, is a small yet breathtaking site in Ravenna. The entire chapel is adorned with mosaics dating back to the late 5th and early 6th centuries, offering visitors an awe-inspiring experience. Adjacent to the chapel is the ancient Neonan Baptistery, adding to the historical allure of the area.
name: Archbishop's Chapel of St. Andrew
address: P.za Arcivescovado, 1, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Octogonal structure ordered by Ostrogothic ruler Theodoric, now about 2m below modern ground level.
detail_description: Battistero degli Ariani is an octagonal structure built by the Ostrogothic ruler Theodoric, now situated about 2 meters below the current ground level. This UNESCO World Heritage site features beautifully crafted and colorful mosaics on its ceiling, depicting the apostles. Originally part of a larger complex, this small building still showcases its beauty despite the loss of the rest.
name: Battistero degli Ariani
address: Piazzetta degli Ariani, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Expansive gardens within the walls of an ancient fortress, with refreshments & an open-air theater.
detail_description: Rocca Brancaleone is a historic fortress in the city, now transformed into expansive gardens and a community space. Inside the ancient walls, visitors can enjoy a playground with various toys and ample space for kids to run around. The site also features a cafeteria and seating area, making it an ideal stop for families. Additionally, there are activities for children and history points that provide insight into its medieval past.
name: Rocca Brancaleone
address: Via Rocca Brancaleone, 35, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Tasting menus of Romagna cuisine featuring renowned antipasti, in a cavernous medieval wine store.
detail_description: Ca' de Vèn is a historic gem in Ravenna, offering a taste of Romagna cuisine in a medieval wine store. The 15th-century setting adds to the allure, making it a must-visit spot. Locals flock here for lunch to savor piadine and grilled dishes like tagliata di pollo. The Enoteca Ca de Ven is renowned for its piadina, a thin flatbread that can be enjoyed plain or filled with various ingredients.
name: Ca' de Vèn
address: Via Corrado Ricci, 24, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

name: Mosaico space invader RA_40 MAR
address: Via di Roma, 13, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: Piazza del Popolo, a historic square in the heart of the city, has been a focal point for locals for over seven hundred years. Its bustling atmosphere is fueled by its open-air cafes and prime location at the intersection of several streets. The square is encircled by an array of impressive architecture, including buildings with municipal, religious, and civic significance. Reflecting Venetian influences, this vibrant square serves as a central hub from which visitors can easily access nearby major attractions.
name: Piazza del Popolo
address: 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: L'Acciuga Osteria is a contemporary seafood restaurant that breaks away from tradition, focusing on the freshness of its fish dishes. The atmosphere is chic yet welcoming. Their menu features a variety of raw and cooked seafood dishes, including pink shrimp tartare, tuna carpaccio, and raw grey mullet with Borretana onions, anchovies, and celery root. Additionally, they offer creative cooked dishes such as crab buttons with mantis shrimp and burnt leek powder.
name: L'Acciuga Osteria
address: Viale Francesco Baracca, 74, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Inventive Italian dishes with a focus on fish, plus a long wine list, in an intimate setting.
detail_description: Osteria Del Tempo Perso is a charming Italian restaurant located near the Basilica di San Vitale. The cozy interior is adorned with shelves of books, records, and wine bottles, creating an intimate atmosphere. The menu focuses on inventive Italian dishes with an emphasis on fish, such as Adriatic seafood tartare and traditional classics like cappelletti and ravioli. The restaurant changes its menu every two months to showcase seasonal ingredients.
name: Osteria Del Tempo Perso
address: Via Gamba, 12, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Convivial trattoria serving up typical Romagna dishes like rabbit, stuffed pasta & filled flatbread.
detail_description: Trattoria La Rustica is a charming and welcoming restaurant that offers a delightful selection of traditional Romagna dishes. The interior exudes a homely atmosphere, adorned with vintage household tools that harken back to simpler times. The menu boasts world-famous cappelletti, soft polenta with melted pit cheese, smoked goose breast, tortellini with meat sauce, and Romagna-style rabbit.
name: Trattoria La Rustica
address: Via Massimo D'Azeglio, 28, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: Experience the timeless charm of Antica Trattoria Al Gallo 1909, a historic trattoria in Ravenna that has been lovingly run by the same family for over a century. The restaurant's Liberty-style decor, adorned with an array of objects and art, creates an enchanting ambiance.
name: Antica Trattoria Al Gallo 1909
address: Via Maggiore, 89, 48123 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: Pasticceria Veneziana is a historic patisserie in Ravenna, established in 1864 and later taken over by the Baccarini family. Despite its long history, it remains a modern sweet shop with an eye for design and presentation. Located in the heart of the shopping district, it offers a wide variety of cakes, biscuits, and pastries that cater to even the most discerning tastes. The interior has recently been renovated to showcase its extensive selection of treats.
name: Pasticceria Veneziana
address: Via Salara, 15, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Elegant accommodations with breakfast, plus a terrace, a garden, several lounges & a library.
detail_description: Nestled in the enchanting old town of Ravenna, Santa Maria Foris is a delightful bed and breakfast that offers an elegant retreat for travelers. With just six spacious rooms and suites, each uniquely adorned with contemporary decor that harmonizes beautifully with original terracotta tiles and Italian wallpaper, guests can enjoy a serene atmosphere. The property boasts lovely amenities including a terrace, garden, several lounges, and even a library for those quiet moments of relaxation.
name: Santa Maria Foris
address: Via Giuseppe Pasolini, 61, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: Annafietta Mosaicisti in Ravenna is a workshop founded by Anna Finelli, where the philosophy is to bring the beautiful Byzantine art of Ravenna mosaics into furnishing accessories. The creations are colorful masterpieces made with hand-cut glass paste tiles allured on concrete, allowing light to create stunning effects. Visitors can find mosaic tiles for DIY projects and even complete kits. The workshop also has an adjoining laboratory where visitors can witness the creation process.
name: Annafietta Mosaicisti | Ravenna
address: Via Giuliano Argentario, 21, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: Via Corrado Ricci is a bustling street located in the heart of Piazza Garibaldi, where numerous exhibitors gather each month. This vibrant area is part of a larger network that includes via Gordini, Piazza dei Caduti, via De Gasperi, Via Diaz and Piazza Einaudi. The street comes alive with a variety of offerings from different vendors, making it an exciting destination for visitors looking to explore local products and crafts.
name: Via Corrado Ricci
address: 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Restored monastery with 20th-century mosaics, plus a statue by Lombardi & a drawing by Klimt.
detail_description: Ravenna Art Museum, located in a restored monastery, is a treasure trove of art and beauty. The city itself is a mosaic of artistic wonders, from monumental gates to artisan workshops. A visit to the museum offers insight into the evolution of mosaic art through its Collection of Contemporary Mosaics, showcasing works from the 20th century to the present day. The museum also houses notable pieces such as a statue by Lombardi and a drawing by Klimt.
name: MAR - Museo d’Arte della Città di Ravenna
address: Via di Roma, 13, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: San Giovanni Evangelista in Ravenna, Italy, is a remarkable basilica steeped in history and religious significance. Founded by the Roman Empress Galla Placidia in 425 AD as an expression of gratitude for her safe passage across the Adriatic Sea, this church has witnessed centuries of change. Its architecture features three naves adorned with classical columns and retains elements from its ancient origins despite suffering damage during World War II.
name: San Giovanni Evangelista, Ravenna
address: V.le Luigi Carlo Farini, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Collection of local religious art & artifacts, plus a Byzantine chapel with elaborate mosaics.
detail_description: The Archiepiscopal Museum in Ravenna is a treasure trove of local religious art and artifacts, including a Byzantine chapel adorned with intricate mosaics. One of its most notable relics is a circular marble slab from the Council of Nicea, famous for fixing the date of Easter. Housed in the historic Archiepiscopal Palace, this museum showcases an array of artworks and historical pieces, such as the pulpit of Maximian and the Saint Andrew Chapel.
name: Archiepiscopal Museum, Ravenna
address: P.za Arcivescovado, 1, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: Museo Dante is situated in Via Dante Alighieri, near the tomb of the great poet. Established in 1921 to honor the 600th anniversary of Dante's death, it showcases his iconography through busts, icons, paintings, and multimedia materials. The museum offers English translations for all exhibits and provides insights into Dante's influence on Italian culture and language. It is a great place to delve deeper into the life and works of the renowned poet.
name: Museo Dante
address: Via Dante Alighieri, 2a, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: Palazzo di Teodorico is an ancient architectural site near the church of Sant'Apollinare Nuovo. It is believed to be the remains of a guard post or possibly an atrium-porch in front of the church dedicated to San Salvatore ad Calchi. The area features a round tower and remnants of mosaic floors discovered during archaeological excavations. The palace, although not the original structure, stands on this historic site, showcasing the shift in the city center over time.
name: Palazzo di Teodorico
address: Via Alberoni, angolo, Via di Roma, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: P.za del Popolo, a historic square in the city, has been home to the town hall for over seven centuries and continues to be a bustling meeting place for locals. The lively atmosphere is fueled by its open-air cafes and central location at the intersection of several streets. Visitors can admire the stunning architecture surrounding the square, which includes buildings serving various civic and religious functions.
name: P.za del Popolo
address: 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Bustling eatery with an old-fashioned atmosphere specializing in traditional flatbread sandwiches.
detail_description: La Piadina del Melarancio is a bustling eatery located in the heart of the city, offering traditional flatbread sandwiches in an old-fashioned atmosphere. The establishment is housed in a historic building and serves piadinas that are thicker and more substantial than those found elsewhere. These delicious flatbreads are filled with a variety of Romagnan cold cuts and cheeses, as well as other options like mozzarella, mushrooms, onions, and spicy salami.
name: La Piadina del Melarancio
address: Via IV Novembre, 31, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Theme park with roller coasters & water & family rides, plus laser gun attraction & live shows.
detail_description: Mirabilandia is Italy's largest amusement park, located in Ravenna. It offers a perfect solution for families with kids and teenagers to have an exciting day out. The park features a variety of thrilling roller coasters, including the popular "Katun," as well as water and family rides. Additionally, visitors can enjoy attractions like laser gun games and live shows.
name: Mirabilandia
address: SS16, 48125 Savio RA, Italy

detail_description: Located near the Dantesco Mausoleum, the Quadrarco di Braccioforte is an ancient oratory with a rich historical significance. The site features an iron gate enclosing a garden filled with memories and two ancient sarcophagi, including one believed to belong to Eliseo Profeta. A plaque marks the spot where Dante's bones rested from 1944 to 1945.
name: Quadrarco di Braccioforte
address: Via Dante Alighieri, 9, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Wildlife park with a drive-thru safari & guided train tours, plus animal feedings & a reptile house.
detail_description: Safari Ravenna is a wildlife sanctuary that offers visitors the chance to drive through the park and embark on guided train tours while admiring various animals. There are also opportunities to feed the creatures and explore the reptile house. The unique experience of driving through a zoo makes it worth visiting if you happen to be in the area. Overall, Safari Ravenna is an excellent destination for animal lovers seeking an unforgettable adventure with exotic wildlife.
name: Safari Ravenna
address: Via dei Tre Lati, 2/X, 48125 Ravenna RA, Italy

excerpt: Large aquatic park in the Mirabilandia theme park, featuring water slides, a lagoon & a lazy river.
detail_description: Mirabeach is a sizeable aquatic park located within the premises of Mirabilandia, designed for water enthusiasts. The area is equipped with multiple rides that cater to different age groups and preferences, including water slides, lazy river, and lagoon. The facility maintains strict security protocols that set an exemplary standard in Italy. Despite its impressive range of options available for visitors, some attractions might not be suitable for younger children between four to seven years old who may not meet height requirements.
name: Mirabeach
address: SS16, 48125 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: The Cathedral of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ, also known as the Neoniano Baptistry, is a charming ancient monument in Ravenna with a domed roof adorned with exquisite mosaic decorations. While not the most beautiful church in Italy, it is still an incredible sight and definitely worth a visit when in town. The cathedral offers visitors the opportunity to admire stunning mosaics and beautiful oil paintings. It's located in the center of Ravenna and provides a great place for meditation.
name: Cathedral of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ
address: Piazza Duomo, 1, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: The Old Port archaeological site is an important part of the ancient area known as Classe, featuring the harbor entrance channel and a bustling shopping district overlooking the canal's south bank. This site provides a glimpse into the prosperous and thriving business hub that existed during the V-VI century. It is a haven for enthusiasts of Roman history, offering a fascinating view of well-preserved ruins.
name: Old Port of Classe - Parco Archeologico di Classe
address: Via Marabina, 7 Zona Ponte Nuovo-Classe, 48124 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: The Cripta Rasponi e i Giardini Pensili del Palazzo della Provincia is a historical site located within the Palazzo della Provincia complex in Piazza San Francesco. The gardens and crypt are some of the oldest surviving parts of the former Palazzo Rasponi, dating back to the late 1700s. While most of the original structure was destroyed by fire in the 1920s, these gardens and crypt have endured.
name: Cripta Rasponi e i Giardini Pensili del Palazzo della Provincia
address: Piazza S. Francesco, 7, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: Giardino Rasponi o delle erbe dimenticate, also known as The Forgotten Herb Garden, is a charming and hidden gem located near Piazza J.F. Kennedy in Ravenna. Once the walled garden of the oldest Rasponi palazzo, it has been beautifully restored and transformed into a public space. This small but beautiful garden is filled with herbs, flowers, and fruits and offers a peaceful retreat in the heart of the city.
name: Giardino Rasponi o delle erbe dimenticate
address: Via Arnaldo Guerrini, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: Classis Ravenna – Museo della Città e del Territorio is a museum located just 400 meters away from the city center. It offers a fascinating collection of archaeological objects and mosaics that tell the history of Ravenna. The museum is housed in an old sugar factory, featuring impressive architecture. Visitors can expect to learn about the ancient history of Ravenna and its former harbor, Classe, through well-curated exhibitions with information available in both English and Italian.
name: Classis Ravenna – Museo della Città e del Territorio
address: Via Classense, 29, 48124 Classe RA, Italy

detail_description: The Lido Arcobaleno is a wonderful seaside destination for families, boasting excellent amenities such as well-maintained facilities, including toilets and showers, along with a pristine beach. The on-site cafe/restaurant offers delicious food and attentive service throughout the day, and even features live music in the evenings. Street parking is available if you arrive early enough to secure a spot, with the area typically being less crowded before lunchtime.
name: Arcobaleno .16
address: Viale Francesco Petrarca, 358, 48122 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: The Civic Tower, situated in the center of Ravenna, Italy, is a slender architectural marvel that graces the heart of the city. This magnificent structure captivates with its awe-inspiring aesthetics. Serving as a museum, this place exudes beauty and charm that is truly remarkable. The tower stands tall and elegant, showcasing an exquisite example of fine craftsmanship. It holds great historical significance and serves as a testament to the rich cultural heritage of Ravenna.
name: Civic Tower
address: Via Ponte Marino, 2, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: The small museum of dolls and toys offers many varieties of dolls for children to explore. The museum is in a very accurate setting, with pieces sorted chronologically and inserted into appropriate scenes. It is definitely worth seeing for children.
name: Small Museum of Dolls and Toys
address: Via Marco Fantuzzi, 4, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: Teatro Comunale Alighieri in Ravenna is a stunning theater known for its captivating decor and architecture. Despite being an older venue, it exudes a unique atmosphere and style that make it a worthwhile destination for a night out in the city. The handling of pandemic measures and social distancing has been commendable, ensuring a safe experience for visitors. Guests have enjoyed marvelous performances at this beautiful theater, such as Mozart's Figaro's wedding, which left them in awe.
name: Teatro Comunale Alighieri, Ravenna
address: Via Angelo Mariani, 2, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

name: Monumento a Giuseppe Garibaldi
address: Piazza Giuseppe Garibaldi, 18, 47032 Bertinoro FC, Italy

detail_description: The NatuRa - Museo ravennate di Scienze Naturali "Alfredo Brandolini" is a museum located in a historic building on Via Rivaletto, 25 in Ravenna. It is also known as the Museo Ravennate of Natural Sciences and houses a valuable collection of birds donated by naturalist Alfredo Brandolini, along with a display of shells from the Adriatic Sea.
name: NatuRa - Museo ravennate di Scienze Naturali "Alfredo Brandolini"
address: Via Rivaletto, 25, 48123 Sant'Alberto RA, Italy

detail_description: Biblioteca Classense in Ravenna is a remarkable library housing the first book printed in Italy (1465) and one of eleven surviving copies of Aristophanes' comedies. The library boasts beautiful paintings, frescoes, and the Dante Hall. It offers free wifi and has a cozy children/youth section with unique drawings and items hanging from high ceilings, creating an artistic atmosphere. Additionally, it provides a vast collection of table games and a real chess table.
name: Biblioteca Classense
address: Via Alfredo Baccarini, 3, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

name: Basilica of Saint John Baptist
address: Via Girolamo Rossi, 45, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: The Catholic church of Saint Mary Magdalene, concealed amidst the facades of the buildings, was constructed in Baroque fashion during the years 1748-1750 on the site where a previous small church stood in 1076. On many occasions, it remains accessible even during nighttime hours. It contains artworks by Andrea Barbiani, one of the prominent painters from the city's eighteenth-century era. Entry is without charge.
name: Chiesa di Santa Maria Maddalena
address: Via Corrado Ricci, 10, 48121 Ravenna RA, Italy

detail_description: The Basilica of Holy Ghost is an ancient orthodox church that is definitely worth a visit. This historical place exudes intrigue and captivates with its rich heritage. Its age-old structure stands as a testament to the past, inviting admiration from all who encounter it. The remarkable architecture and sacred atmosphere make it an interesting destination for those seeking cultural immersion or simply wanting to explore the depths of history.
name: Basilica of Holy Ghost
address: Piazzetta degli Ariani, 1, 48100 Ravenna RA, Italy
